title: Educator Introduction to C++ Intermediate Level C++
description:
Introduction to C++

Duration 9 hours 20 minutes

Alvin Sylvain utilizes his M.S. in Computer Science and decades of experience programming and tutoring to instruct Educator.com's Introduction to C++ course. Alvin makes learning C++ as easy as possible with lessons that first focus on theory and sample code, before diving into compiling and troubleshooting actual code and applications. Alvin's teaching experience allows him to show users how to avoid common pitfalls for the beginner programmer. Topics span across all of C++ including Setting up your Compiler, Variables, Types, Pointers, Loops, and Object-Oriented Programming. Alvin includes Homework and Downloadable Files with his lessons to cement understanding of important principles.

Intermediate Level C++

Duration 12 hours 30 minutes

Professor Alvin Sylvain returns to teach you how the C++ programming language can be both enjoyable and highly useful. Professor Sylvain makes learning C++ as easy as possible with lessons that first focus on theory and sample code, before diving into compiling and troubleshooting actual code and applications. His extensive teaching experience also allows him to effectively show users how to avoid common pitfalls. This intermediate C++ course covers topics from Templates to Exception Handling and is perfect whether you're a seasoned programming professional or just moving on from Alvin's introductory course. Professor Sylvain has an M.S. in Computer Science and over 20 years of experience teaching and tutoring students in C++.
